intro: Allium scorodoprasum var. minus, commonly known as lesser chive, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild, onion-like flavor, making it a useful herb in culinary applications. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
